intro: Clibadium remotiflorum, commonly known as the distant-flower sycamore, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its seeds are dispersed by water, contributing to its spread in moist environments.
